page.title: 03GOULCEBY 1980s
page.content: Life here in 1985,is far more comfortable for most people than at any time in the past.Houses are in a better condition,better heated and drier.The coming of electricity and piped water have completely changed the lives of country people.Electric lighting,television and radio,and domestic appliances are commonplace. Kitchens have steel sinks with hot and cold water.We have bathrooms and inside toilets,but no mains sewerage in the villages:each house has a septic tank.This may be emptied by the Council on payment of Â£38. There are no street lamps and the houses are not numbered,but named.The roads have no name plates,nor is there a village name sign,so many strangers find it difficult to know where people live.All pay Water rates,and household refuse is collected once a week.
